item.title: Coronavirus: Travel industry's future uncertain, with fairs cancelled or postponed
item.description:
May 08, 2020 2:22 PM

SINGAPORE (THE NEW PAPER) - Just like many Singaporeans' travel arrangements, plans for the country's biggest biannual travel fairs are also up in the air.

item.title: Robot reminds visitors about safe distancing measures in Bishan-Ang Mo Kio Park
item.description:
May 08, 2020 2:11 PM

SINGAPORE - A four-legged robot will be patrolling Bishan-Ang Mo Kio Park to remind people of safe distancing measures starting from Friday (May 8).

item.title: Doxxed CEO wrongly identified as 'sovereign' woman thanks supporters
item.description:
May 08, 2020 2:11 PM

SINGAPORE (THE NEW PAPER) - The chief executive officer of a tech company who was wrongly identified and doxxed has thanked people who defended her and her company.

item.title: Man who allegedly attended social gathering in Circuit Road amid coronavirus outbreak charged
item.description:
May 08, 2020 1:34 PM

A 38-year-old man who is said to have left his flat to attend a social gathering at a woman's home was later served an invite he could not refuse - a day in court.

item.title: Green Pulse Podcast: Science + Trivia = Covid-19 quarantine fun
item.description:
May 08, 2020 12:00 PM

Green Pulse is an environmental podcast series at The Straits Times which analyses the beat of the changing environment, from biodiversity conservation to climate change.

item.title: Coronavirus: HDB resale flat volume hits 30-year low, falls 78% in April with only 423 units changing hands
item.description:
May 08, 2020 11:43 AM

SINGAPORE - The volume of Housing Board resale flats plummeted by 78.3 per cent in April from March to a level that observers say could be a historical low, as circuit breaker measures put in place to stem the spread of the coronavirus curb house viewings.

item.title: Coronavirus: Teen allegedly linked to video of boy sampling drinks at supermarket to plead guilty
item.description:
May 08, 2020 11:42 AM

SINGAPORE - A 17-year-old youth, who is allegedly linked to a video of a boy sampling drinks at an NTUC FairPrice supermarket before placing them back on a shelf, intends to plead guilty to one count of being a public nuisance.

item.title: Coronavirus: SIA expects full-year net loss for first time in its history
item.description:
May 08, 2020 10:14 AM

A small operating profit is still expected for the full year, the airline said.

item.title: #Stayhome reads: A uniquely Singaporean romance, and other inspiring tales of love and hope
item.description:
May 08, 2020 8:00 AM

Take a breather from news on Covid-19 with these five heartfelt stories about Singaporeans who have found new hope when all seems bleak.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on May 8
item.description:
May 08, 2020 7:39 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Friday, May 8.

item.title: 10 must-reads for today
item.description:
May 08, 2020 5:00 AM

Families practising mindfulness, new believers being brought into the faith and a concert featuring Buddhist singers and musicians from around the world. All these activities to commemorate Vesak Day were held online yesterday. Amid the Covid-19 pandemic, Buddhists in Singapore and around the world adapted, observing Vesak Day virtually for the first time.

item.title: Buddhists mark Vesak Day with virtual celebrations amid Covid-19 pandemic
item.description:
May 08, 2020 5:00 AM

Families piecing together jigsaw puzzles to practise mindfulness, new believers being brought into the Buddhist faith through a refuge ceremony, and an international concert starring Buddhist singers and musicians from around the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: Mustafa Centre partially reopens
item.description:
May 08, 2020 5:00 AM

About one month after it was identified as a Covid-19 cluster, Mustafa Centre has reopened its doors - with additional safety measures in place.

item.title: Law academy rolling out $1.9m support package for legal sector
item.description:
May 08, 2020 5:00 AM

The Singapore Academy of Law (SAL) will be rolling out support measures to help individuals in the legal profession as well as law firms.

item.title: Coronavirus: Conditions in dorms not main reason for clusters, says Tan Chuan-Jin
item.description:
May 08, 2020 5:00 AM

The highly contagious nature of the coronavirus and the fact that dorms involve groups of people living in close quarters are more likely to have contributed to the spread, said Mr Tan.

item.title: Singapore landmarks lit in blue to put spotlight on mental health
item.description:
May 08, 2020 5:00 AM

The city centre was transformed last night when around 30 landmarks such as Marina Bay Sands and the Esplanade were lit up in varying shades of blue as part of the #SeeItBlue movement.

item.title: Coronavirus: Bettering migrant workers' lives calls for whole-of-society effort, say experts
item.description:
May 08, 2020 5:00 AM

Improving the wages and living conditions of foreign workers in Singapore requires a whole-of-society effort. Not only must the Government take the lead in making structural changes, but Singaporeans, too, must change their us-versus-them mindset, said analysts.

item.title: NUS sets aside $6m to fund grads' ideas for a better world
item.description:
May 08, 2020 5:00 AM

The National University of Singapore (NUS), which last week offered its graduating students jobs and paid traineeships to weather the expected recession, is rolling out a scheme for its recent graduates to innovate to create a better post-pandemic world.

item.title: Singaporeans' efforts to help those hit by coronavirus pandemic encouraging: Tan Chuan-Jin
item.description:
May 08, 2020 5:00 AM

It is a reflection of society's maturity that Singaporeans are stepping forward to help those affected by the Covid-19 pandemic and the efforts so far have been encouraging, said Speaker of Parliament Tan Chuan-Jin yesterday.

item.title: Dutch lilies and Kenyan roses for Mother's Day
item.description:
May 08, 2020 5:00 AM

It was only after his mother died of breast cancer two years ago that Mr Jaryl Wong realised the importance of Mother's Day.

item.title: Coronavirus: Some curbs still needed after Covid-19 circuit breaker ends, says expert
item.description:
May 08, 2020 5:00 AM

The virus would be able to re-circulate if there were no more distancing measures, setting the stage for another peak in infections, said an expert.

item.description:
May 08, 2020 5:00 AM

Customers flocked back to Mustafa Centre after it was allowed to re-open about a month after it was identified as a Covid-19 cluster.

item.title: Fourth person working at Singapore Expo among 741 new coronavirus cases
item.description:
May 08, 2020 5:00 AM

A fourth person working at the Singapore Expo community care facility has contracted the coronavirus, as 741 new cases were reported here yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Urgent IVF cases allowed to proceed, says MOH
item.description:
May 08, 2020 5:00 AM

The coronavirus pandemic has not only upended many lives but also aborted the plans of some couples to bring new life into the world via in-vitro fertilisation (IVF).

item.title: Coronavirus: Animal welfare groups to meet MND, NParks
item.description:
May 08, 2020 5:00 AM

The Covid-19 outbreak is taking a toll on the operations of animal welfare groups in Singapore as donations drop and fewer volunteers are allowed on the premises.

item.title: NEA's $1.76m fund to help minimise food wastage
item.description:

The National Environment Agency (NEA) has committed $1.76 million to a new fund that will help alleviate the problem of food wastage.
